56-year-old white female.context: The patient is a 56-year-old white female with a history of relapsing polychondritis, which resulted in saddle nose deformity in glottic and subglottic stenosis for which she has undergone number of procedures in the past to the upper airway.

relapsing polychondritis.context: The patient is a 56-year-old white female with a history of relapsing polychondritis, which resulted in saddle nose deformity in glottic and subglottic stenosis for which she has undergone number of procedures in the past to the upper airway.

saddle nose deformity.context: The patient is a 56-year-old white female with a history of relapsing polychondritis, which resulted in saddle nose deformity in glottic and subglottic stenosis for which she has undergone number of procedures in the past to the upper airway.

glottic and subglottic stenosis.context: The patient is a 56-year-old white female with a history of relapsing polychondritis, which resulted in saddle nose deformity in glottic and subglottic stenosis for which she has undergone number of procedures in the past to the upper airway.

trach dependent.context: She currently is trach dependent for her airway because of glottic and subglottic stenosis, but she is having no significant problems breathing and talking around her trach tube and came for further evaluation.

no significant problems breathing.context: She currently is trach dependent for her airway because of glottic and subglottic stenosis, but she is having no significant problems breathing and talking around her trach tube and came for further evaluation.

no significant problems talking.context: She currently is trach dependent for her airway because of glottic and subglottic stenosis, but she is having no significant problems breathing and talking around her trach tube and came for further evaluation.

suspension microlaryngoscopy.context: Operation Performed: Suspension microlaryngoscopy, rigid bronchoscopy, dilation of tracheal stenosis.

rigid bronchoscopy.context: Operation Performed: Suspension microlaryngoscopy, rigid bronchoscopy, dilation of tracheal stenosis.

dilation of tracheal stenosis.context: Operation Performed: Suspension microlaryngoscopy, rigid bronchoscopy, dilation of tracheal stenosis.

airway obstruction.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Airway obstruction secondary to laryngeal subglottic stenosis.

laryngeal subglottic stenosis.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Airway obstruction secondary to laryngeal subglottic stenosis.

tracheal stenosis.context: Postoperative Diagnosis: Airway obstruction secondary to laryngeal subglottic stenosis and tracheal stenosis.

good dentition.context: Oral cavity, hypopharynx, larynx, and nasal cavity showed good dentition with good tongue, buccal cavity, and mucosa without lesions.

good tongue.context: Oral cavity, hypopharynx, larynx, and nasal cavity showed good dentition with good tongue, buccal cavity, and mucosa without lesions.

buccal cavity.context: Oral cavity, hypopharynx, larynx, and nasal cavity showed good dentition with good tongue, buccal cavity, and mucosa without lesions.

mucosa without lesions.context: Oral cavity, hypopharynx, larynx, and nasal cavity showed good dentition with good tongue, buccal cavity, and mucosa without lesions.

significant scarring.context: Larynx was suspended with significant scarring beginning in the supraglottic area with loss of laryngeal contour beginning in the supraglottis with extensive scar tissue at the level of the false cord obliteration of ventricles and true cords.

loss of laryngeal contour.context: Larynx was suspended with significant scarring beginning in the supraglottic area with loss of laryngeal contour beginning in the supraglottis with extensive scar tissue at the level of the false cord obliteration of ventricles and true cords.

extensive scar tissue.context: Larynx was suspended with significant scarring beginning in the supraglottic area with loss of laryngeal contour beginning in the supraglottis with extensive scar tissue at the level of the false cord obliteration of ventricles and true cords.

obliteration of ventricles.context: Larynx was suspended with significant scarring beginning in the supraglottic area with loss of laryngeal contour beginning in the supraglottis with extensive scar tissue at the level of the false cord obliteration of ventricles and true cords.

true cords.context: Larynx was suspended with significant scarring beginning in the supraglottic area with loss of laryngeal contour beginning in the supraglottis with extensive scar tissue at the level of the false cord obliteration of ventricles and true cords.

mild-to-moderate subglottic stenosis.context: However, distally, the level of the trach site examined with the microscope and 0 and 30-degree telescopes. The patient noted to have marked narrowing with dense scarring posterolaterally on the left securing good visualization of the trach tube.

marked narrowing.context: However, distally, the level of the trach site examined with the microscope and 0 and 30-degree telescopes. The patient noted to have marked narrowing with dense scarring posterolaterally on the left securing good visualization of the trach tube.

dense scarring.context: However, distally, the level of the trach site examined with the microscope and 0 and 30-degree telescopes. The patient noted to have marked narrowing with dense scarring posterolaterally on the left securing good visualization of the trach tube.

LP contact tip laser.context: The LP contact tip laser was utilized to vaporize the scar tissue and release the scar banding following which the scope was passed and further dilation carried out.

vaporize the scar tissue.context: The LP contact tip laser was utilized to vaporize the scar tissue and release the scar banding following which the scope was passed and further dilation carried out.

release the scar banding.context: The LP contact tip laser was utilized to vaporize the scar tissue and release the scar banding following which the scope was passed and further dilation carried out.

further dilation.context: The LP contact tip laser was utilized to vaporize the scar tissue and release the scar banding following which the scope was passed and further dilation carried out.

widely patent.context: Mid and distal trachea were widely patent.

no obvious disease.context: Trachea and mainstem bronchi were patent without obvious disease.

tolerated the procedure well.context: The patient tolerated the procedure well without complications and was taken to recovery room in satisfactory condition.

without complications.context: The patient tolerated the procedure well without complications and was taken to recovery room in satisfactory condition.
